title: Léa Garcia, Brazilian actress known for ‘Black Orpheus,’ dies at 90
description: She was credited with helping to expand the opportunities available to Black Brazilian actors on the stage and screen.

title: U.S. soldier in Texas wounds man in unusual cross-border shooting
description: The soldier was deployed as part of Operation Lone Star, the border mobilization directed by Gov. Greg Abbott (R) in an effort to reduce illegal crossings.

title: Russia says it will question U.S. diplomats about former consulate worker
description: The FSB says it intends to questions two American diplomats about a Russian citizen charged with improperly gathering information about the war in Ukraine for the U.S.

title: Putin, stained by Prigozhin’s death, faces calls for military funeral
description: Wagner chief Yevgeniy Prigozhin, who died last week, secretly received Russia’s highest honor, but it is unclear if he will have the ceremonial funeral normally granted to state heroes.

title: Poland investigates train mishaps for possible Russian connection
description: Saboteurs broadcast three tonal signal on the railway’s radio network, which automatically brings all trains in the vicinity to a halt.

title: Glitch hits British air space, delaying flights on busy holiday weekend
description: London’s Heathrow airport is one of the busiest international airports in the world, and even small disruptions can cause significant ripple effects in other countries.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Prigozhin’s death confirmed via DNA tests, Russia says
description: The identities of all 10 people aboard the Embraer business jet that crashed last week have been verified, Russia’s Investigative Committee said.

title: Thousands gather at annual Redhead Days Festival in the Netherlands
description: The Redhead Days Festival started informally in 2005, after an artist received an overwhelming response to an ad seeking red-haired models.

title: Behind the AI boom, an army of overseas workers in ‘digital sweatshops’
description: Thousands of workers in the Philippines labor for San Francisco start-up Scale AI. Many don’t always get paid.

title: Stable U.S.-China ties ‘profoundly important,’ Commerce Secretary says
description: Gina Raimondo is the latest in a series of senior Biden administration officials to visit Beijing to reset the relationship between the world’s two economic superpowers.
